meanings.definition: to shout or call out loudly
meanings.sent1: She hollas for her dog when it runs away.
meanings.sent2: The coach hollas instructions to the players during the game.
meanings.sent3: The baby hollas for attention when she wants to be picked up.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm hollas its presence with booming thunder.
meanings.sent5: His hollas echoed through the empty hallway, startling everyone.

meanings.sent1: The hollas of the fans filled the stadium with excitement.
meanings.sent2: She let out a hollas of joy when she won the prize.
meanings.sent3: The hollas of the auctioneer added energy to the event.
meanings.sent4: The hollas of the protesters could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent5: His hollas pierced through the silence of the night, waking up the neighbors.

meanings.sent1: The hollas laughter of the children could be heard from the playground.
meanings.sent2: The party was filled with hollas music and dancing.
meanings.sent3: The hollas celebration lasted late into the night.
meanings.sent4: The hollas crowd cheered on the team with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: Her hollas personality always brought smiles to those around her.
